description:
Johnny Thunders
RÃƒÂ¼hrersaal, NÃƒÂ¼rnberg, Germany
September - 11 - 1988





**********************************
from SEETHELIGHT7 collection # 580
**********************************




Rec. Info:
SONY D6 + AIWA CM 30 Mic -> mastertape -> transfer via Nakamichi tapedeck DR3 -> wav-file -> wetransfer -> Magix Music Cleaning Lab (edit/remaster) -> FLAC -> DIME 
Very good sounding recording after some EQ was done (bass and treble lifted). One gap in track 17 removed (I think you won't hear it).



Ladies and gentlemen here is a so far uncirculated show from our hero right from the depths of NÃƒÂ¼rnberg's RÃƒÂ¼herersaal (nice little tongue twister for all lowbrows of German language).
For Thunders hardcore fans the 1988 tour took maybe a little getting used to due to the sax attendance and the lady vocals in the background but at the end that's just some nice
accessories to the man himself who stayed what he always was, the greatest impersonator of dirty ass rock'n'roll.
To him it was always a seal of approval that never one show was like the other. And on this tour even the songs seemed to be different from show to show. Here we get a wonderful version of
of So Alone and a marathon on Gloria right at the end of the concert.
I would love to see a tape of the show from Munich 3 days earlier where I have been but maybe even this will appear one day.  





Setlist (tape length 89:04)

01 - Intro
02 - Glory Glory  
03 - Blame It On Mom
04 - In Cold Blood -> I'm Not Your Stepping Stone/Hit the Road Jack
05 - I Can Tell
06 - Sad Vacation
07 - Just Another Girl
08 - Crazy
09 - Pipeline
10 - Louie Louie/Hang On Sloopy
11 - ? 
12 - Too Much Junkie Business
13 - Children Are People Too
14 - Little Queenie
15 - Uptown To Harlem 
16 - So Alone
17 - Born To Lose
18 - Gloria






Johnny Thunders and The Oddballs:

Johnny Thunders - lead vocals, lead guitar
Stevie Klasson - guitar
Jill Wisoff - bass
Jamie Heath - saxophone
Alison Gordy - vocals 
Chris Musto - drums
